column4: Hi I've found a ssh tutorial and it says to enter "ssh yourusername@yourhomeaddress" but I've only got an ip not a domain and I couldn't get it too work
do this:  ssh yourUserName@yourIPAddress
silly question but I was entering xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx should I have left out the periods
no, leave the periods.  for example: ssh Trek@127.0.0.1
if I were connecting to the right username and computer :P
okay well when I did that I was getting a cursor blinking but no prompt so I ctrl +c out of it
shouldn't I have gotten a prompt?
is port 22 open?  did you install the ssh packages?
yeah I forwarded port 22 and installed openssh-server
maybe I haven't actually got it running
did you reboot your comp?
no haven't rebooted
do this in command line: apt-get install --reinstall openssh-server
it should also find the dependencies
if that doesn't work, then it might not be installed:  apt-get install openssh-server
then accessing it externally is the issue...
do you use a firewall on your comp?
router
no firewall
is IP tables blocking incoming traffic?
if it is I haven't set it up
i'll assume its not blocking traffic...
perhaps that was the case, wrong IP.  try using the IP on whatismyip.com
that ip is incorrect my isp must have a transperant proxy or something I've just got the correct ip from my router config
